job_title: PCT/CNA in Brooklyn, NY
pros: They are great. That pay is good, always get paid in time.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Overland Park, KS
pros: A nonprofit organization with an existing revenue stream is great place to be in. Most nonprofits struggle for funding and identifying revenue sources at the beginning, where Krucial now has a unique opportunity to advocate for better treatment and advancement of nursing and healthcare professionals as well as help place them in competitive positions. Old leadership and "bad seeds" have since exited the organization. People who were unqualified have found ways to exit the organization, allowing qualified and new ideas in. Variety of backgrounds from a leadership perspective, but all with nonprofit experience.
cons: As the organization has shifted, many still harbor ill feelings towards past leadership, events, or policies that no longer apply. It is a start up company working through growing pains.

job_title: Logistics Coordinator in Overland Park, KS
pros: Work environment is amazing. Small company so most people get along well
cons: Again, small company so your asked to do things not generally within ones job description

review_title: Rebranded to Krucial Rapid Response for a Reason
job_title: Operations Specialist in Overland Park, KS
pros: Decent pay if I had to say anything, but average for the area.
cons: - Toxic work environment. Slander and gossip galore. - No room for mobility-- higher level staff are chosen based on relation and not merit. - No work-life balance - No benefits That said, if you're not related to someone there, you're going to get canned. I watched these heartless people fire a boatload of top performers a week before Christmas 2022, only to turn around and hire their family a couple of weeks later. Hate having all bad things to say but this is the worst place I've ever worked in my career.

job_title: Social Media Specialist in Kansas City, KS
pros:
- If you’re lucky enough, you might be a part of a nice team that’s supportive and fun
- the pay was decent (20 hourly), and weekly pay outs
- sometimes not much to do, leaving a lot of time for literally whatever
cons:
- if you are working in the corporate office, check the reviews from people in corporate, not medical or deployed staff. It’s very telling.
- all and I mean ALL the higher-ups are white, and there’s a severe lack of diversity in higher-paid roles
- when you DO have work, expect to be micromanaged and talked down to 
- no growth opportunities. They use temp staffing at full time hours and even after months of working, they obviously have no intent to move to permanent or salary (unless, of course, you’re white)
- some employees are incredibly disrespectful and lack social skills. I’d been chastised for not cleaning up a mess I didn’t make. literally zero respect.
- the ex CEO left for supporting anti-maskers. how ironic.
- speaking of anti-mask, during COVID (2021) in-office events were often held with people still not wearing masks.
- you aren’t asked for something, you’re demanded for it. and if that something is unattainable, people get extremely upset even when things are out of your hands. Not sure if this is a cross-departmental issue but the lack of communication skills here are baffling.
- micromanaging. micromanaging. micromanaging. lunch is at your desk and if you pass a threshold out of the front door to grab door dash or anything, you’re logged out of the hour-tracking system and repeatedly asked to prove your hours.

review_title: Beware! Don't work at the Corporate office!
job_title: in Overland Park, KS
pros: No Pros in working here. They make you believe they care about the Covid-19 pandemic, they don't. The company just cares about getting rich off of the Covid-19 pandemic.
cons: The leads and managers in the Operations department have never been leads or managers, and it shows. They all act like they are in high school. The females gossip, throw people under the bus and work together to get people fired. If you are good at being fake like them and feed their egos, you might last a couple months. I have seen them hire a ton of people and fire them two weeks later. Don't waste your time. This company is a joke.

job_title: Business Development in Overland Park, KS

review_title: Krucial feels like home,  the employees feel like family and the owners couldn't be more supportive to their staff
job_title: Workman's Compensation Manager in Overland Park, KS
pros:
The atmosphere is fun and inviting. 
Krucial provides drinks and food .
Bonuses for temp employees.
Krucial treats everyone even temporary staff like family. 
Krucial works hard and plays hard. 
Krucial Kares - We do what is right in every aspect of our jobs.
When you can Krucial you get to speak with real Krucial employees when you call 24/7.
Krucial staff on the ground fighting this pandemic of Covid19 are treated and considered as heroes. With out our Heroes we couldn't be doing what we do.
cons:
The only con is that we are fighting this deadly disease that is rapidly becoming increasingly alarming. Our front line staff are away from their families, seeing death daily and facing getting sick themselves. 
Covid19 is the only Con but Krucial is finding a way to help any support facilities providing nursing staff when they are short, providing medical care where it's needed and management to help support those Frontline staff. 
There are no Cons to working for Krucial unless your afraid to work and be held accountable.

review_title: Beat place to work treated like Family

job_title: Operations Specialist in Kansas City, MO
pros:
Pretty friendly team mates. 
Work hard-play hard type of company. 
Very generous bonus and incentives. 
Comfortable workspace. 
Spacious work space. 
Clean workspace.
cons:
Will fire you out of nowhere. 
Very learn as you go, as the hire ups have no clue what they’re doing most of the time. When you make a mistake, you will be penalized although you have little to no training. If you’re looking for a full time position at corporate office look else where. They’ll use you until they don’t need you anymore and then let you go, and then call you back a few days later when they need a reliable worker, and then fire them a few days later after the heavy work is done.

job_title: Director of Culture in Overland Park, KS
pros: Two words: the people! From the corporate employees, both salaried and contract - to the hard working medical professionals and onsite reps we have out in the field, every member of this magical Krew is so passionate about what we do and serving our mission! The corporate staff really know how to have a good time while working hard and making the work environment something you want to come back to day after day. We truly are one big family that takes care of each other and supports each other day after day!
cons: The hours can be long, but when you know what you're doing is actively saving lives, it's worth it!
